text:
Hey! I’m looking for some help with a phone number formatting issue for HubSpot SMS. Our SMS tool requires phone numbers to have a country code (e.g., `+1` for U.S.), but many of our contacts' numbers are missing this. We want to automate adding the country code using a custom-coded workflow action.
Does anyone have a sample code snippet or example workflow that handles adding country codes to phone numbers if they are missing? Ideally, the code should:
• Detect if a number lacks a country code.
• Automatically add `+1` for 10-digit U.S. numbers.
• Leave numbers with existing country codes unchanged.
I’d appreciate any guidance, code examples, or advice on best practices for this! Thanks in advance for your help! :blush:

hi <@U07S7UM05PW> quick question!

are all the numbers of US or its a mix database of different countries?
